results.title: Run nickel run: the making of a movie
results.creator_credit: Syd Donovan and TVW Channel Seven
results.brief_description: Documents the making of the feature film “Nickel Queen”. This Australian production directed by John McCallum and starring Googie Withers told the story of the widowed owner of the Mirribilli pub’s sudden turn of fortune during the mining boom in Western Australia. Includes a scene with John Laws as a hippie.

results.title: Run Lola run = Lola Rennt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stefan Arndt, Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR, X filme creative Pool and Tom Tykwer
results.brief_description: Time is running out for Lola (Franka Potente). She’s just received a frantic phone call from her boyfriend Manni (Moritz Bleibtreu), who’s lost a small fortune in cash belonging to his Mob boss. Now she has to run for his life, to try and come up with the money before Manni pays the ultimate price for his mistake. Using a destiny device, the story begins anew with different outcomes. Other cinematic techniques which add to the breakneck pace and excitement of this innovative thriller include jump cuts, whip pans, slow and fast motion, split-screen, intercut colour and black and white, segment titles and animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stefan Arndt, Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR, X filme creative Pool and Tom Tykwer

results.title: Run for your life
results.brief_description: Examines the reasons why runners of all ages have opted for this form of exercise. Interviews with joggers and physicians point out the psychological and medical benefits of running and stress the importance of cardiovascular health in today’s urban, sedentary lifestyle. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Run Dick, run Jane
results.creator_credit: Brigham Young University and Scott Whitaker
results.brief_description: Based on Kenneth Cooper’s book, “The New Aerobics”, shows how regular exercise can be valuable insurance against heart disease. Illustrates through laboratory statistics and case studies the benfits of a personal fitness program. Includes views of Peter Strudwick, who jogs with no feet, and Larry Lewis, 103 year-old San Francisco waiter who ran six miles every morning before work.

results.title: Rumtek Monastery
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Bill Steller, Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Concentrates on the Buddhist Monastery at Rumtek, a small village in the tiny Himalayan kingdom of Sikkin. Explores in detail what is perhaps one of the purest remaining examples of practising Tibetan Buddhism. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: Rumpelstilzchen. Passion
results.creator_credit: Barooni, Light Cone, Jurgen Reble and Re:Voir
results.brief_description: Using Super-8 and an experimental technique of allowing bacterial decomposition and chemical breakdown of the film emulsion, a practice Jurgen Reble worked on as a former member of the German filmmaking group known as “Schmelzdahin” during the 1980s, “Rumpelstilzchen” and “Passion” feature as part of Reble’s first solo works in this unusual and surrealistic style of filmmaking. Familiar to both pieces is the often repetitive and pulsating rhythmic soundtrack and images using both micro and macro cinematography and themes of creation, evolution and destruction. An intriguing concept and interpretation into the chemistry of life.

results.title: Rumpelstiltskin
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: One of a series of films in which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. This film is an adaptation of the well-known fairy tale of the miller’s daughter and the strange little man who spun straw into gold for her.

results.title: Rumor: a challenge film
results.creator_credit: Centre for Mass Communication of Columbia University Press
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which asks the question - “What defence against rumours?” Shows the spread of rumours in an actual case at Detroit some years ago. Mass panic and riots were caused by rumours resulting from a Sunday traffic jam.
